field.name: summary
field.value: AjaxHelper uses innerHTML, which fails under certain circunstances

field.name: description
field.value:
AjaxHelper uses the non-standard innerHTML property when performing Ajax callbacks.
innerHTML fails when using the content-type "application/xhtml+xml" in Gecko (this content-type is currently not supported by Internet Explorer). For testing, you can add to a velocity template the following:
#set($response.ContentType="application/xhtml+xml")
The javascript code which calls the innerHTML can be found in the file: MonoRail/Castle.MonoRail.Framework/Controllers/Ajax.resx
I'm attaching a patch containing an alternative for innerHTML I'm currently using.
